channel.title: duration on Stats On the T
channel.description: Recent content in duration on Stats On the T

item.title: Will Freshness be a Factor at the French Open?
item.description: In reaching the quarterfinal at the 2018 French Open, Alexander Zverev not only has earned the best Grand Slam result of his career, he also joins a short list of 4 men in the Open Era who have played 3 or more five-set matches on their way to the Roland Garros quarterfinals. Is Zverev’s gruelling journey to the second week most likely to hurt or help his chances for the title?

item.title: Is Fatigue Cumulative?
item.description: Fighting off fatigue in any Grand Slam match is a challenge. Does this get even harder after multiple matches?

item.title: Measuring Match Fatigue
item.description: A talk at the recent New England Symposium on Statistics in Sport (NESSIS) made me wonder whether we can observe player fatigue in tennis matches? and how?

item.title: Has Too Much Play Finally Caught Up with Top Men?
item.description: The 2017 US Open draw is out. But much of the talk this year will be on the names not included in the draw.
